claim: All volcanic ash is gray.
correction: Ash color varies with mineral content and eruption chemistry.

claim: Only desert animals use burrows to stay cool.
correction: Animals in many climates use burrows for temperature regulation and safety.

claim: Jellyfish are fish.
correction: Jellyfish are invertebrates in the phylum Cnidaria, not fish.

claim: All salts taste salty.
correction: Some salts taste bitter or sweet depending on their ions.

claim: All animals sleep with eyes closed.
correction: Some animals sleep with eyes open or semi-closed for vigilance.

claim: Mars has blue sunsets like Earth.
correction: Martian sunsets appear bluish near the Sun due to dust scattering, but skies are mostly butterscotch.

claim: You can't get sunburned through glass.
correction: UVA can penetrate glass and cause skin damage.

claim: All spiders are venomous to humans.
correction: Most spiders have venom for prey but are harmless to humans.

claim: Magnets always stick to all metals.
correction: Magnets attract ferromagnetic metals like iron, nickel, cobalt; not all metals are magnetic.

claim: Plant roots always grow straight down.
correction: Roots grow toward moisture and nutrients; they branch and spread.

claim: Lightning cannot strike the same person twice.
correction: People have been struck multiple times.

claim: Cooking destroys all nutrients.
correction: Some nutrients reduce; others become more bioavailable after cooking.

claim: Diamonds burn at any temperature.
correction: Diamonds can burn but require high heat and oxygen.

claim: Every black hole is the same size.
correction: Black holes range from stellar-mass to supermassive.

claim: All fish lay thousands of eggs.
correction: Some fish lay few eggs or bear live young.

claim: Microwave ovens heat food by cooking from the center first.
correction: Microwaves penetrate and heat unevenly; edges can heat first.

claim: All lizards drop their tails when threatened.
correction: Autotomy varies; not all lizards can or do drop tails.

claim: Snow at the poles is always powdery and dry.
correction: Snow texture varies; coastal polar snow can be wet or compacted.

claim: Helium balloons rise forever into space.
correction: Balloons burst or leak as pressure drops; they don't reach space.

claim: Only humans get sunburn.
correction: Animals with sparse fur or light skin can sunburn.

claim: All pollution is visible as smoke or smog.
correction: Many pollutants are invisible gases or particulates.

claim: You can't start a fire in the rain.
correction: With dry tinder and shelter, fire can be started in rain.

claim: Every cloud type produces turbulence for airplanes.
correction: Turbulence risk varies by cloud type; some clouds are relatively smooth.

claim: The Moon has a permanent atmosphere like Earth.
correction: The Moon has a very tenuous exosphere, not a thick atmosphere.

claim: Bird bones are hollow and fragile so they break easily.
correction: Pneumatic bones have supportive struts and can be strong.

claim: All rainbows appear only opposite the Sun at 42 degrees exactly.
correction: Primary rainbows center opposite the Sun near 42 degrees, but angle varies slightly with droplet size and secondary bows differ.

claim: Cold weather kills all insects instantly.
correction: Many insects overwinter via dormancy or antifreeze compounds.

claim: All sap is maple syrup before processing.
correction: Sap composition varies by tree; maple sap is mostly water and needs concentration.

claim: Whales squirt water from their blowholes.
correction: Blowhole plumes are exhaled air and condensed moisture, not ingested seawater.

claim: Storm surges are giant waves like tsunamis.
correction: Storm surges are sea level rises driven by wind and pressure, not single waves.

claim: Cacti grow only in deserts.
correction: Some cacti live in forests, mountains, and coastal regions.

claim: All snakes use venom to digest prey externally.
correction: Venom subdues prey; digestion occurs internally.

claim: Goldfish stop growing at a fixed genetic size regardless of tank size.
correction: Growth depends on genetics, water quality, and care; poor conditions stunt growth.

claim: Seawater is uniformly salty at all depths.
correction: Salinity varies with depth, currents, and freshwater input.

claim: Every whale is a filter feeder.
correction: Some whales (like orcas) are predators; baleen whales filter feed.

claim: Sand is identical worldwide.
correction: Sand composition varies: quartz, shell, volcanic, gypsum, etc.

claim: All lakes freeze solid in winter in cold regions.
correction: Many lakes freeze only at the surface; deeper layers stay liquid.

claim: The speed of sound is the same at all temperatures.
correction: Sound speed increases with temperature.

claim: Lightning never originates from the ground.
correction: Upward leaders can initiate strikes from tall structures.

claim: All mushrooms glow in the dark.
correction: Only some fungi are bioluminescent.

claim: Bamboo only grows in Asia.
correction: Bamboo species grow on multiple continents.

claim: The tallest trees are found only in tropical rainforests.
correction: Coastal redwoods in temperate zones are among the tallest.

claim: All tides are predictable to the minute years in advance.
correction: Tides are modeled but local factors and weather introduce variability.

claim: Cows have four stomachs.
correction: Cows have one stomach with four chambers.

claim: Hurricanes form only over the Atlantic Ocean.
correction: Tropical cyclones form in multiple basins (typhoons, cyclones).

claim: All plants die immediately without soil.
correction: Hydroponics and other soilless methods can sustain plant growth.

claim: Only male birds sing.
correction: Females in many species also sing.

claim: All rocks are solid and never melt on Earth.
correction: Rocks can melt into magma under high heat and pressure.

claim: Every animal has a backbone.
correction: Invertebrates lack backbones and make up most animal species.

claim: The ozone hole exists only over the North Pole.
correction: The most pronounced ozone depletion occurs over Antarctica.

claim: All rivers eventually flow to the ocean without exception.
correction: Some rivers end in inland basins or evaporate.

claim: Venus has no volcanoes.
correction: Venus has many volcanic features and likely past eruptions.

claim: Every earthquake creates a visible surface crack.
correction: Many quakes leave no obvious surface rupture.

claim: Only coastal areas have tsunamis.
correction: Tsunamis impact coasts but originate offshore; inland areas away from coasts are unaffected.

claim: Rain always falls as drops of the same size.
correction: Drop size varies with conditions and rainfall type.

claim: The Moon is the same brightness everywhere on its surface.
correction: Albedo varies; maria are darker than highlands.

claim: The higher you go, the more oxygen percentage increases.
correction: Oxygen percentage remains roughly constant; pressure decreases with altitude.

claim: All lightning is cloud-to-ground static discharge only.
correction: Lightning involves charge separation; many strikes are intra-cloud or cloud-to-cloud.

claim: Rip currents pull swimmers underwater to the bottom.
correction: Rip currents pull seaward at the surface; they don't drag you down.

claim: Venus always shows a full disk from Earth.
correction: Venus exhibits phases like the Moon when viewed from Earth.

claim: Thunder can shatter glass by sound alone regularly.
correction: Thunder's pressure waves rarely shatter glass; it's uncommon and needs proximity.

claim: All penguins live on ice year-round.
correction: Many penguins breed on rocky shores or temperate islands.

claim: Rainforest humidity prevents any fires.
correction: Rainforests can experience fires during droughts.

claim: Canyons form only from river erosion over millions of years.
correction: Canyons can form from tectonics, glacial action, or rapid erosion too.

claim: Every tornado has the same funnel shape.
correction: Tornado shapes vary: rope, cone, wedge, multi-vortex.

claim: All deserts are expanding northward only.
correction: Desert boundaries shift in different directions based on regional factors.

claim: All compass needles point exactly to the North Pole.
correction: Compasses point to magnetic north, which moves and differs from geographic north.

claim: Fresh snow is sterile.
correction: Snow can contain microbes and airborne particles.

claim: Tectonic plates move only a few millimeters per million years.
correction: Plates move centimeters per year on average.

claim: Lightning always strikes during rainfall.
correction: Dry lightning occurs without surface rain.

claim: All glass is transparent to visible light equally.
correction: Glass types vary in tint and transmission; some block portions of visible light.

claim: Antarctica has no fossils.
correction: Fossils including dinosaurs and plants have been found in Antarctica.

claim: Every glacier is shrinking today.
correction: Most are retreating, but some are stable or advancing due to local conditions.

claim: Wind is caused by Earth's rotation only.
correction: Wind results from pressure differences driven by uneven heating; rotation influences direction (Coriolis).

claim: All deserts are below sea level.
correction: Many deserts are at high elevations or above sea level.

claim: Comets are icy because they come from inside Jupiter's orbit.
correction: Comets originate far beyond Jupiter; inner Solar System warms them producing tails.

claim: Ocean tides stop during storms.
correction: Tides continue; storm surge adds to normal tidal levels.

claim: Geodes contain diamonds by default.
correction: Geodes typically contain quartz or calcite crystals, not diamonds.

claim: Sand dunes are fixed and never move.
correction: Dunes migrate with wind over time.

claim: Lava is red everywhere.
correction: Lava can appear orange, yellow, red, even glowing white depending on temperature.

claim: All planets have rings if observed closely.
correction: Only some planets, like Saturn, Jupiter, Uranus, and Neptune, have ring systems.

claim: Earthquakes are more common during full moons due to gravity.
correction: Studies show little to no significant correlation between phase and quakes.

claim: Volcanoes erupt on a predictable schedule like geysers.
correction: Volcanic activity is complex; precise schedules are unlikely.

claim: Ocean currents flow only east to west.
correction: Currents flow in diverse patterns driven by wind, rotation, and density differences.

claim: Every aquatic mammal has a dorsal fin.
correction: Many lack dorsal fins, such as manatees and some whales.

claim: All clouds form at the same altitude.
correction: Cloud types form at various altitudes from near-surface fog to cirrus high aloft.

claim: Every volcano emits the same gases.
correction: Gas composition varies; common gases include water vapor, CO2, SO2, but ratios differ.

claim: All rocks are formed from magma.
correction: Sedimentary and some metamorphic rocks form without molten precursors.

claim: Lightning never occurs in snowstorms.
correction: Thundersnow features lightning within snowstorms.

claim: All caves are dark at the entrance.
correction: Entrances can be lit; darkness prevails deeper inside.

claim: Every desert day is scorching hot.
correction: Desert temperatures can be mild or cold, especially at night or in winter.

claim: All lakes have outlets.
correction: Endorheic lakes have no outlets and lose water via evaporation.

claim: Rivers always carve V-shaped valleys.
correction: Glacial erosion carves U-shaped valleys; rivers can widen to plains.

claim: All snowflakes are six-pointed without exception.
correction: Most have hexagonal symmetry, but shapes vary; some form needles or plates.

claim: Earth's core is entirely solid iron.
correction: The outer core is liquid iron-nickel; inner core is solid.

claim: Every rainstorm cleans the air completely.
correction: Rain can remove particulates but may not clear all pollutants; humidity can trap smog.

claim: The equator is windless year-round.
correction: The equatorial doldrums have variable winds; storms and squalls occur.

claim: No life exists below ocean floors.
correction: Microbial life thrives in deep subsurface sediments and rocks.

claim: Mountain glaciers are freshwater because ice purifies minerals completely.
correction: Glacial meltwater can carry sediments and minerals; ice excludes most salts but not all impurities.

claim: Lightning only happens in tall thunderclouds over land.
correction: Lightning occurs over oceans and in varied storm types and sizes.

claim: All sulfur smells like rotten eggs.
correction: Elemental sulfur is nearly odorless; hydrogen sulfide smells of rotten eggs.

claim: All rainfall comes from the ocean originally.
correction: Evaporation from soil, lakes, rivers, and transpiration also supply atmospheric moisture.

claim: A single tornado can easily lift an entire house intact and set it down miles away.
correction: Tornadoes usually destroy structures; intact transport is rare and often exaggerated.

claim: Every planet's day is shorter than its year.
correction: On Venus, a day is longer than its year; relationships vary by planet.

claim: Fossil fuels are made only from dinosaurs.
correction: They derive mainly from ancient plants, algae, and microorganisms.

claim: All rivers are freshwater throughout.
correction: Estuaries mix fresh and saltwater; some rivers become brackish near mouths.

claim: Temperature alone determines whether snow or rain falls.
correction: Vertical temperature profiles and humidity determine precipitation type.

claim: Clouds block all solar radiation effectively.
correction: Clouds reduce some radiation but UV and visible light can penetrate.

claim: All metamorphic rocks were once igneous.
correction: Metamorphic rocks can form from sedimentary or igneous precursors.

claim: Only deserts can have dust storms.
correction: Dust storms can occur in dry soils anywhere with loose particles and wind.

claim: All tsunami waves are over 30 meters high.
correction: Tsunami heights vary widely; some are small at sea and grow near shore.

claim: Earth's mantle is fully molten.
correction: Most mantle is solid but plastic; partial melt occurs in specific zones.

claim: Hurricanes are getting stronger solely because of natural cycles.
correction: Natural variability exists, but warming seas and climate change influence intensity trends.

claim: Every sand grain is a tiny piece of quartz.
correction: Sand composition varies widely with local geology.

claim: All thunderstorms produce tornadoes.
correction: Only a small fraction spawn tornadoes under specific conditions.

claim: Ocean tides are caused only by the Moon; the Sun has no effect.
correction: Both the Moon and Sun influence tides; the Moon's effect is stronger.

claim: All mountains are found on continents.
correction: Undersea mountains (seamounts) are abundant in oceans.

claim: Flat Earth models were universally accepted until Columbus.
correction: Scholars knew Earth was spherical long before Columbus.

claim: All beaches are sandy.
correction: Beaches can be rocky, pebbly, shelly, or volcanic black sand.

claim: Rain smells because water itself is fragrant.
correction: Petrichor comes from soil oils and geosmin released when rain hits dry ground.

claim: Lightning cannot strike frozen lakes.
correction: Lightning can strike ice surfaces and travel through or across them.

claim: Every volcano emits lava hotter than the Sun's surface.
correction: Lava is much cooler (about 700-1200 C) than the Sun's surface (about 5500 C).

claim: All deserts are expanding faster than forests.
correction: Trends vary regionally; some deserts shrink while forests can also expand or contract.

claim: Every earthquake causes a tsunami.
correction: Most earthquakes do not; only certain undersea quakes with vertical displacement can.

claim: You can tell longitude by looking at Polaris height.
correction: Polaris elevation gives latitude; longitude requires time reference.

claim: Every ice crystal in a cloud must be hexagonal plates.
correction: Ice crystals take many shapes: columns, plates, dendrites, needles.

claim: All geysers erupt on predictable intervals like Old Faithful.
correction: Intervals vary; many geysers are irregular.

claim: Only Earth has auroras.
correction: Auroras occur on planets with magnetic fields and atmospheres, like Jupiter and Saturn.

claim: Snow is white because it contains bleach.
correction: Snow appears white due to light scattering by ice crystals.

claim: Deltas form only at river mouths into oceans.
correction: Deltas also form in lakes and inland basins.

claim: All wood floats.
correction: Some dense woods, like lignum vitae, can sink.

claim: A mirage is a reflection of the sky on water.
correction: Mirages result from light bending in air temperature gradients.

claim: All deserts have dunes that sing when the wind blows.
correction: Booming dunes are rare; most dunes are silent.

claim: Meteor showers are caused by random space rocks each time.
correction: They occur when Earth passes through comet debris streams.

claim: Icebergs always show 90% of their mass above water.
correction: Typically about 10% is above water; most mass is submerged.

claim: All weather happens in the troposphere only.
correction: Most weather is tropospheric, but phenomena like noctilucent clouds occur higher.

claim: Sandstorms cannot cross oceans.
correction: Dust plumes can travel thousands of kilometers across oceans.

claim: Every polar bear is left-handed.
correction: No evidence supports handedness claims; they use both paws.

claim: You can't hear thunder more than 10 miles away.
correction: Under certain conditions, thunder can be heard over 15 miles away.

claim: All deserts are lifeless.
correction: Deserts host diverse flora and fauna adapted to aridity.

claim: Tornadoes can pick up and relocate lakes intact.
correction: Tornadoes can move water and debris but not relocate entire lakes.

claim: Every earthquake is preceded by many foreshocks.
correction: Some quakes have foreshocks; many do not.

claim: All fossils are mineralized bones only.
correction: Fossils include impressions, tracks, and preserved organic material beyond bones.

claim: Glaciers move because ice melts entirely underneath.
correction: Glaciers move by internal deformation and basal sliding; not all ice melts underneath.

claim: Only sunlight makes rainbows.
correction: Any bright light with droplets can create rainbows, including moonlight (moonbows).

claim: All deserts are defined by temperature.
correction: Deserts are defined by low precipitation, not temperature.

claim: Lightning only occurs in cumulonimbus clouds.
correction: Lightning can occur in volcanic plumes, snowstorms (thundersnow), and pyrocumulus.

claim: Sinkholes occur only in karst limestone areas.
correction: Sinkholes can form in various substrates from mining, piping erosion, or dissolution.

claim: All marine life disappears below the photic zone.
correction: Many organisms live in deep aphotic zones.

claim: The Earth's tilt is fixed forever.
correction: Axial tilt shifts slowly over time (obliquity cycles).
